description.compact: The divider is used to work out the maximum number of days we should be from the date.

docblock.description:
The Further back in time we go, the greater the margin of error.
For example, if you search for a date that is one year ago, then the margin of error is 360/12 = 30 days. if we search for yesterdaty then the margin of error is one.
The calculation works as follow: [today] - [searched day] / [divider].
If it is set to 90 this means that for every 90 day you can be one day off.
All variables are in days.
